Dear Amanda Garza:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 8/8/23. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and
date an updated treatment plan for each resident at
least once every 90-calendar days following the initial
treatment plan.
1 of 2 updated treatment plans were incomplete. The plan was not signed and it
did not include progress made. The report was also dated 3 days late.

CCI Rule 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan
(4) The social service worker shall sign and date the
initial treatment plan.
2 of 2 updated treatment plans reviewed were not signed.
CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional
care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge:
(c) An assessment of the resident’s needs that
remain to be met.
2 out of 2 discharge plans reviewed did not include the youth's needs that still
needed to be met.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Attach youth contacts to the treatment plan.
• Update treatment plans to include independent living skills.
• Discharge form should also be updated so the services provided and needs
that remain to be met are included on the form.
• Ensure the supervisor is signing the treatment plans and the youth are signing
the discharge plans to indicate they reviewed the plans.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• It is recommended that supervisory staff work during the busy shifts rather than
regular business hours.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There was 1 substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. The facility reported an incident in which a youth was able to get the keys
to the agency vehicle, steal it, and crash it. SIR 2023C0000534 found the facility in
violation of R 400.4109 (1)(c ) Program statement due to staff not following agency

policies and R 400.4112 (4) Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications due to the staff member being confirmed.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
• The facility reported an incident in which a staff member restrained a
youth. The facility is not approved to utilize restraints so SIR
2023C0000383 was initiated and found the facility in violation of R
400.4109 (1) (c ) Program statement due to staff not following the
facility's policies. A CAP was approved on 7/19/23. The facility is still
being monitored for compliance with their CAP, but all action steps have
been completed.
• A CAP was approved on 8/9/23 for the above Maltreatment
investigation. The facility is still being monitored for compliance with their
CAP, but all action steps have been completed.
Financial Overview
Financial audit and budget were reviewed, and no concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator submitted her annual report which indicated the corrective
action plans from the recent investigations are being worked on and are helping to
ensure staff are following the agencies policies and procedures. The facility did not
have any CAP’s to work on from the previous inspection.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported they enjoyed working at the facility and did not have any
concerns.
The youth interviewed stated she did not want to be at the facility and would rather
be home, but she felt safe and did not have any concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility was clean and organized with no safety issues observed.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
